context: The United States presidential line of succession is the order in which persons may become or act as President of the United States if the incumbent president becomes incapacitated , dies , resigns , or is removed from office ( by impeachment by the House of Representatives and subsequent conviction by the Senate ) . The line of succession is set by the United States Constitution and the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 as subsequently amended to include newly created cabinet offices . The succession follows the order of vice president , Speaker of the House of Representatives , President pro tempore of the Senate , and then the heads of federal executive departments who form the Cabinet of the United States . The Cabinet currently has fifteen members , beginning with the Secretary of State , and followed by the rest in the order of their positions ' creation . Those heads of department who are ineligible to act as president are also ineligible to succeed the president by succession , for example most commonly if they are not a natural - born U.S. citizen .
topic: What are the eligibility criteria for heads of department to act as president, and why are these criteria in place?
question: What are the eligibility criteria for heads of department to act as president, and why are these criteria in place to ensure continuity in the government?

choices.A: The heads of department must be natural-born U.S. citizens, have taken the oath of office, and be resident within the United States for at least 14 years.
choices.B: The heads of department must be at least 35 years old, have been a resident within the United States for at least 14 years, and have been a natural-born U.S. citizen.
choices.C: The heads of department must have served as a Senator or Representative for at least 6 years, have been a resident within the United States for at least 14 years, and be a natural-born U.S. citizen.
choices.D: The heads of department must be a natural-born U.S. citizen, have taken the oath of office, and have been a resident within the United States for at least 7 years.

explanation: The correct answer is B, as it correctly states the eligibility criteria for heads of department to act as president, which are being at least 35 years old, having been a resident within the United States for at least 14 years, and being a natural-born U.S. citizen.

context: Article Five of the United States Constitution describes the process whereby the Constitution , the nation 's frame of government , may be altered . Altering the Constitution consists of proposing an amendment or amendments and subsequent ratification . Amendments may be proposed either by the Congress with a two - thirds vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate or by a convention of states called for by two - thirds of the state legislatures . To become part of the Constitution , an amendment must be ratified by either -- as determined by Congress -- the legislatures of three - quarters of the states or state ratifying conventions in three - quarters of the states . The vote of each state ( to either ratify or reject a proposed amendment ) carries equal weight , regardless of a state 's population or length of time in the Union .
topic: How is a convention of states called for the purpose of proposing amendments, and what is the required participation threshold?
question: What is the minimum participation threshold required to call a convention of states for the purpose of proposing amendments to the United States Constitution?

choices.A: A simple majority vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate
choices.B: A two-thirds vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate
choices.C: A two-thirds vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate, or by a convention of states called for by two-thirds of the state legislatures
choices.D: A unanimous vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate

explanation: The correct answer is C, as the Constitution requires a two-thirds vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate, or a convention of states called for by two-thirds of the state legislatures to propose amendments.

context: A player has taken two hat - tricks in the same Test match only once . Playing for Australia against South Africa in the first match of the 1912 Triangular Tournament at Old Trafford , Manchester , England , leg spinner Jimmy Matthews took a hat - trick in South Africa 's first and second innings , both taken on 28 May 1912 . He completed both hat - tricks by dismissing South Africa 's Tommy Ward . Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat - trick : Australian off spinner Hugh Trumble ( two years apart , between the same teams at the same ground ) , Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram ( just over a week apart , in consecutive matches between the same teams ) and English fast bowler Stuart Broad . Three players have taken a hat - trick on their Test debut : English medium pace bowler Maurice Allom in 1930 , New Zealand off - spinner Peter Petherick in 1976 , and Australian pace bowler Damien Fleming in 1994 . Geoff Griffin took the fewest total Test wickets of any player who recorded a hat - trick , taking only eight wickets in his entire Test career . During the match in which he took his hat - trick , Griffin was repeatedly called for throwing by the umpires and never bowled again in a Test match . Australian Peter Siddle is the only bowler to take a hat - trick on his birthday , and Bangladeshi off spinner Sohag Gazi is the only player to score a century and take a hat - trick in the same Test match .
topic: How does the context of the match and the opposing team affect a bowler's performance?
question: What is the primary factor that distinguishes bowlers who have taken multiple hat-tricks in Test cricket from those who have achieved this feat only once?

choices.A: Their ability to adapt to different match conditions and opposing teams.
choices.B: The quality of their bowling skills and strategies.
choices.C: The level of pressure and expectation surrounding their performances.
choices.D: The presence of a specific teammate or support staff.

explanation: The correct answer is B, as the context highlights the unique skills and strategies employed by bowlers who have taken multiple hat-tricks in Test cricket.

context: A player has taken two hat - tricks in the same Test match only once . Playing for Australia against South Africa in the first match of the 1912 Triangular Tournament at Old Trafford , Manchester , England , leg spinner Jimmy Matthews took a hat - trick in South Africa 's first and second innings , both taken on 28 May 1912 . He completed both hat - tricks by dismissing South Africa 's Tommy Ward . Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat - trick : Australian off spinner Hugh Trumble ( two years apart , between the same teams at the same ground ) , Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram ( just over a week apart , in consecutive matches between the same teams ) and English fast bowler Stuart Broad . Three players have taken a hat - trick on their Test debut : English medium pace bowler Maurice Allom in 1930 , New Zealand off - spinner Peter Petherick in 1976 , and Australian pace bowler Damien Fleming in 1994 . Geoff Griffin took the fewest total Test wickets of any player who recorded a hat - trick , taking only eight wickets in his entire Test career . During the match in which he took his hat - trick , Griffin was repeatedly called for throwing by the umpires and never bowled again in a Test match . Australian Peter Siddle is the only bowler to take a hat - trick on his birthday , and Bangladeshi off spinner Sohag Gazi is the only player to score a century and take a hat - trick in the same Test match .
topic: How many other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat-trick?
question: Which two cricketers took hat-tricks in consecutive matches against the same teams?

choices.A: Jimmy Matthews and Hugh Trumble
choices.B: Jimmy Matthews and Wasim Akram
choices.C: Hugh Trumble and Wasim Akram
choices.D: Wasim Akram and Stuart Broad

explanation: The question requires the domain expert to recall the specific information about cricketers who took hat-tricks in consecutive matches against the same teams.

context: The flag of the United States of America , often referred to as the American flag , is the national flag of the United States . It consists of thirteen equal horizontal stripes of red ( top and bottom ) alternating with white , with a blue rectangle in the canton ( referred to specifically as the `` union '' ) bearing fifty small , white , five - pointed stars arranged in nine offset horizontal rows , where rows of six stars ( top and bottom ) alternate with rows of five stars . The 50 stars on the flag represent the 50 states of the United States of America , and the 13 stripes represent the thirteen British colonies that declared independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain , and became the first states in the U.S. Nicknames for the flag include The Stars and Stripes , Old Glory , and The Star - Spangled Banner .

choices.D: The stars represent the 50 states of the United States of America, each with its unique culture and history.

explanation: The correct answer is A, as the 50 stars on the flag represent the 50 states of the United States of America, signifying unity and a single nation.

context: The United States presidential line of succession is the order in which persons may become or act as President of the United States if the incumbent President becomes incapacitated , dies , resigns , or is removed from office ( by impeachment by the House of Representatives and subsequent conviction by the Senate ) . The line of succession is set by the United States Constitution and the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 as subsequently amended to include newly created cabinet offices . The succession follows the order of Vice President , Speaker of the House of Representatives , President pro tempore of the Senate , and then the heads of federal executive departments who form the Cabinet of the United States . The Cabinet currently has fifteen members , beginning with the Secretary of State , and followed by the rest in the order of their positions ' creation . context: A player has taken two hat - tricks in the same Test match only once . Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat - trick : Australian off spinner Hugh Trumble ( two years apart , between the same teams at the same ground ) , Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram ( just over a week apart , in consecutive matches between the same teams ) and English fast bowler Stuart Broad . context: The United States presidential line of succession is the order in which persons may become or act as President of the United States if the incumbent President becomes incapacitated , dies , resigns , or is removed from office ( by impeachment by the House of Representatives and subsequent conviction by the Senate ) . The line of succession is set by the United States Constitution and the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 as subsequently amended to include newly created cabinet offices . The succession follows the order of Vice President , Speaker of the House of Representatives , President pro tempore of the Senate , and then the heads of federal executive departments who form the Cabinet of the United States . The Cabinet currently has fifteen members , beginning with the Secretary of State , and followed by the rest in the order of their positions ' creation . Those heads of department who are ineligible to act as President are also ineligible to succeed the President by succession , for example most commonly if they are not a natural - born U.S. citizen .

choices.B: The heads of federal executive departments who are eligible to act as President are those who are appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate.

choices.D: The heads of federal executive departments who are eligible to act as President are those who are not members of the Cabinet of the United States and have not been impeached by the House of Representatives.

context: The flag of the United States of America , often referred to as the American flag , is the national flag of the United States . It consists of thirteen equal horizontal stripes of red ( top and bottom ) alternating with white , with a blue rectangle in the canton ( referred to specifically as the `` union '' ) bearing fifty small , white , five - pointed stars arranged in nine offset horizontal rows , where rows of six stars ( top and bottom ) alternate with rows of five stars . The 50 stars on the flag represent the 50 states of the United States of America , and the 13 stripes represent the thirteen British colonies that declared independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain , and became the first states in the U.S. Nicknames for the flag include The Stars and Stripes , Old Glory , and The Star - Spangled Banner .
topic: Describe the symbolism behind the colors used on the American flag.

choices.B: The red stripes symbolize the bloodshed of American patriots, while the white stripes represent the hope for a better future.
choices.C: The red stripes represent the 13 original colonies, while the white stripes symbolize the unity of the states.
choices.D: The red stripes represent the sun, while the white stripes symbolize the moon.

explanation: The correct answer is C, as the red stripes represent the 13 original colonies, and the white stripes symbolize the unity of the states.

context: A player has taken two hat - tricks in the same Test match only once . Playing for Australia against South Africa in the first match of the 1912 Triangular Tournament at Old Trafford , Manchester , England , leg spinner Jimmy Matthews took a hat - trick in South Africa 's first and second innings , both taken on 28 May 1912 . He completed both hat - tricks by dismissing South Africa 's Tommy Ward . Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat - trick : Australian off spinner Hugh Trumble ( two years apart , between the same teams at the same ground ) , Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram ( just over a week apart , in consecutive matches between the same teams ) and English fast bowler Stuart Broad . Three players have taken a hat - trick on their Test debut : English medium pace bowler Maurice Allom in 1930 , New Zealand off - spinner Peter Petherick in 1976 , and Australian pace bowler Damien Fleming in 1994 . Geoff Griffin took the fewest total Test wickets of any player who recorded a hat - trick , taking only eight wickets in his entire Test career . During the match in which he took his hat - trick , Griffin was repeatedly called for throwing by the umpires and never bowled again in a Test match . Australian Peter Siddle is the only bowler to take a hat - trick on his birthday , and Bangladeshi off spinner Sohag Gazi is the only player to score a century and take a hat - trick in the same Test match .
topic: Who is the only player to score a century and take a hat-trick in the same Test match?
question: Who is the only player to score a century and take a hat-trick in the same Test match, and which team was the opponent in that match?

choices.A: Australian bowler Stuart Broad and South Africa
choices.B: Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram and Australia
choices.C: Bangladeshi off spinner Sohag Gazi and South Africa
choices.D: Australian bowler Damien Fleming and England

explanation: The correct answer is C, as Sohag Gazi is the only player to score a century and take a hat-trick in the same Test match, and the opponent in that match was South Africa.

context: Article Five of the United States Constitution describes the process whereby the Constitution , the nation 's frame of government , may be altered . Altering the Constitution consists of proposing an amendment or amendments and subsequent ratification . Amendments may be proposed either by the Congress with a two - thirds vote in both the House of Representatives and the Senate or by a convention of states called for by two - thirds of the state legislatures . To become part of the Constitution , an amendment must be ratified by either -- as determined by Congress -- the legislatures of three - quarters of the states or state ratifying conventions in three - quarters of the states . The vote of each state ( to either ratify or reject a proposed amendment ) carries equal weight , regardless of a state 's population or length of time in the Union .

context: `` I Can Only Imagine '' ( sometimes shortened to `` Imagine '' ) is a single recorded by Christian rock band MercyMe . context: England did not enter the competition until 1950 , but have entered all eighteen subsequent tournaments . Their best ever performance is winning the Cup in the 1966 tournament held in England , whilst they also finished in fourth place in 1990 , in Italy , and in 2018 in Russia . Other than that , the team have reached the quarter - finals on nine occasions , the latest of which were at the 2002 ( South Korea / Japan ) and the 2006 ( Germany ) .

context: The 2022 FIFA World Cup is scheduled to be the 22nd edition of the FIFA World Cup , the quadrennial international men 's football championship contested by the national teams of the member associations of FIFA . It is scheduled to take place in Qatar in 2022 . This will be the first World Cup ever to be held in the Arab world and the first in a Muslim - majority country . This will be the first World Cup held entirely in geographical Asia since the 2002 tournament in South Korea and Japan ( the 2018 competition in Russia featured one geographically Asian venue , Yekaterinburg ) . context: A player has taken two hat - tricks in the same Test match only once . Playing for Australia against South Africa in the first match of the 1912 Triangular Tournament at Old Trafford , Manchester , England , leg spinner Jimmy Matthews took a hat - trick in South Africa 's first and second innings , both taken on 28 May 1912 . He completed both hat - tricks by dismissing South Africa 's Tommy Ward . Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test hat - trick : Australian off spinner Hugh Trumble ( two years apart , between the same teams at the same ground ) , Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram ( just over a week apart , in consecutive matches between the same teams ) and English fast bowler Stuart Broad . Three players have taken a hat - trick on their Test debut : English medium pace bowler Maurice Allom in 1930 , New Zealand off - spinner Peter Petherick in 1976 , and Australian pace bowler Damien Fleming in 1994 . Geoff Griffin took the fewest total Test wickets of any player who recorded a hat - trick , taking only eight wickets in his entire Test career . During the match in which he took his hat - trick , Griffin was repeatedly called for throwing by the umpires and never bowled again in a Test match . Australian Peter Siddle is the only bowler to take a hat - trick on his birthday , and Bangladeshi off spinner Sohag Gazi is the only player to score a century and take a hat - trick in the same Test match .
topic: In what year and against which team did Jimmy Matthews take two hat-tricks in the same Test match?
question: In what year and against which team did Jimmy Matthews take two hat-tricks in the same Test match?

choices.A: Jimmy Matthews took two hat-tricks against England in 1913.
choices.B: Jimmy Matthews took two hat-tricks against South Africa in 1912.
choices.C: Jimmy Matthews took two hat-tricks against Australia in 1911.
choices.D: Jimmy Matthews took two hat-tricks against New Zealand in 1914.

explanation: The correct answer is B because Jimmy Matthews took two hat-tricks against South Africa in the first match of the 1912 Triangular Tournament at Old Trafford, Manchester, England.
